plants.name: Chrysanthemum morifolium
plants.description: Chrysanthemums are popular autumn-blooming garden flowers known for their vibrant colors and diverse forms. They often signal the arrival of late fall and are widely cultivated in temperate zones for decorative purposes.
plants.location: Temperate regions worldwide (e.g., North America, Europe, East Asia)
plants.funFact: In Japan, chrysanthemums symbolize the Emperor and the Imperial family and are celebrated during the 'Festival of Happiness'.

plants.name: Acacia dealbata
plants.description: A fast-growing evergreen tree with fluffy, fragrant yellow flowers that blanket the tree in late fall to early winter, offering early color in Mediterranean and subtropical climates.
plants.location: Australia (native), cultivated in Mediterranean and subtropical regions
plants.funFact: Silver Wattle flowers are used to produce a fragrant honey highly prized in Australia.

plants.name: Camellia japonica
plants.description: An evergreen shrub or small tree with glossy leaves and large, rose-like flowers that bloom from mid-fall through winter, often in shaded garden settings.
plants.location: East Asia (native), cultivated in gardens worldwide
plants.funFact: Camellias are highly valued in East Asian culture, symbolizing admiration and perfection.

plants.name: Leucadendron lanigerum
plants.description: A protea family shrub with woolly flower cones that bloom in spring to early summer in the Southern Hemisphere, sometimes extending into November in certain regions like coastal South Africa.
plants.funFact: Leucadendrons are fire-adapted plants that regenerate vigorously after wildfires in their native fynbos ecosystem.
